intro: Cheilanthes bockii, commonly known as the Bock's rockcap, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is a small, evergreen epiphytic or lithophytic fern, typically found growing on rocks or tree trunks in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has a short, thick rhizome with a rosette of leathery, dark green to grayish-green leaves. Its fronds are pinnately compound, with a distinctive, rounded shape and a dense covering of fine hairs. Cheilanthes bockii is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in harsh, rocky habitats.
